2.text: “Should a wise man answer with vain knowledge, and fill himself with the east wind?

3.text: Should he reason with unprofitable talk, or with speeches with which he can do no good?

4.text: Yes, you do away with fear, and hinder devotion before God.

5.text: For your iniquity teaches your mouth, and you choose the language of the crafty.

6.text: Your own mouth condemns you, and not I. Yes, your own lips testify against you.

7.text: “Are you the first man who was born? Or were you brought forth before the hills?

8.text: Have you heard the secret counsel of God? Do you limit wisdom to yourself?

9.text: What do you know, that we don’t know? What do you understand, which is not in us?

10.text: With us are both the gray-headed and the very aged men, much elder than your father.

11.text: Are the consolations of God too small for you, even the word that is gentle toward you?

12.text: Why does your heart carry you away? Why do your eyes flash,

13.text: That you turn your spirit against God, and let such words go out of your mouth?

14.text: What is man, that he should be clean? What is he who is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?

15.text: Behold, he puts no trust in his holy ones. Yes, the heavens are not clean in his sight;

16.text: how much less one who is abominable and corrupt, a man who drinks iniquity like water!

17.text: “I will show you, listen to me; that which I have seen I will declare:

18.text: (Which wise men have told by their fathers, and have not hidden it;

19.text: to whom alone the land was given, and no stranger passed among them):

20.text: the wicked man writhes in pain all his days, even the number of years that are laid up for the oppressor.

21.text: A sound of terrors is in his ears. In prosperity the destroyer shall come on him.

22.text: He doesn’t believe that he shall return out of darkness. He is waited for by the sword.

23.text: He wanders abroad for bread, saying, ‘Where is it?’ He knows that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.

24.text: Distress and anguish make him afraid. They prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.

25.text: Because he has stretched out his hand against God, and behaves himself proudly against the Almighty;

26.text: he runs at him with a stiff neck, with the thick shields of his bucklers;

27.text: because he has covered his face with his fatness, and gathered fat on his thighs.

28.text: He has lived in desolate cities, in houses which no one inhabited, which were ready to become heaps.

29.text: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall their possessions be extended on the earth.

30.text: He shall not depart out of darkness. The flame shall dry up his branches. By the breath of God’s mouth shall he go away.

31.text: Let him not trust in emptiness, deceiving himself; for emptiness shall be his reward.

32.text: It shall be accomplished before his time. His branch shall not be green.

33.text: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive tree.

34.text: For the company of the godless shall be barren, and fire shall consume the tents of bribery.

35.text: They conceive mischief, and bring forth iniquity. Their heart prepares deceit.”
